intro: Canscora justicioides, commonly known as the African violet or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
